param.name: name_style
param.label: Name Style
param.description: The name style details how you want to capture the name field in Joomla.

param.name: name_format
param.label: Name Format
param.description: Choose how to display the Formatted Name (formatname) field.

param.name: date_format
param.label: Date Format
param.description: Choose which date format you would like your date fields to be displayed in.

param.name: time_format
param.label: Time Format
param.description: Choose which time format you would like your datetime fields to be displayed in.

param.name: calendar_type
param.label: Calendar Type
param.description: Choose which calendar you would like to use for dates selection.

param.name: allow_email_display
param.label: Email Handling
param.description: Choose how to display Primary Email Address (email) field.

param.name: allow_email_public
param.label: Public Email Form
param.description: Choose if Primary Email Address (email) email form should be publicly accessible (non-registered users).

param.name: allow_email_replyto
param.label: Emails Sent From
param.description: Choose emails are sent from system email notifications. Sending from admin is SPF spam-checking compliant, but may result in erroneous replies. Sending from user will ensure user receives all replies and mailer errors for better privacy.

param.name: allow_email
param.label: Email Links
param.description: Choose if email fieldtypes should link the email addresses.

param.name: allow_website
param.label: Website Links
param.description: Choose if website fieldtypes should link the website addresses.

param.name: allow_onlinestatus
param.label: Online Status
param.description: Choose if users current online status should display.

param.name: icons_display
param.label: Field Icons
param.description: Choose which field icons should be shown for a fields edit display.

param.name: login_type
param.label: Login Method
param.description: Choose how users should login when using the CB Login Module and Login page.

param.name: reg_admin_allowcbregistration
param.label: Allow User Registration
param.description: Choose if registration access should be same as the CMS or allow registration regardless of CMS settings. Recommended to set Yes to be independent of CMS and turn off registration within the CMS settings.

param.name: emailpass
param.label: Generate Registration Passwords
param.description: Choose if users passwords should be generated or user defined during registration. A user will receive their generated password from the Pending email.

param.name: reg_admin_approval
param.label: Admin Approval
param.description: Choose if users registration should require an admins approval.

param.name: reg_confirmation
param.label: Email Confirmation
param.description: Choose if users registration should require email confirmation. A user will receive their confirmation link from the Pending email.

param.name: reg_username_checker
param.label: Ajax Username Checker
param.description: Choose if username availability should be checked. This feature is protected, but it could be used for username guessing and allow for easier password guessing.

param.name: reg_ipaddress
param.label: Log Registration IP Address
param.description: Choose if ip address should be stored with a users registration. Note this only applies to new registrations.

param.name: reg_show_login_on_page
param.label: Show Login form next to Registration form
param.description: Choose if login form should be automatically displayed on the registration form. Note this uses the parameters of the first login module found.

param.name: reg_email_name
param.label: Registration Email Name
param.description: Input the name to send with registration emails. If left blank default site from name will be used. Default language string REGISTRATION_EMAIL_FROM_NAME will translate into "[sitename] Sign Up"

param.name: reg_email_from
param.label: Registration Email Address
param.description: Input the email address to send registration emails from. If left blank default site from address will be used.

param.name: reg_email_replyto
param.label: Registration Reply-To Email Address
param.description: Input the reply to email address to send with registration emails.

param.name: reg_email_html
param.label: Registration Email HTML
param.description: Choose if registration emails should be sent with HTML.

param.name: reg_pend_appr_sub
param.translated-default: Your sign up request is pending approval
param.label: Pending Email Subject
param.description: Input the subject to send with Pending emails. Leave Pending Subject and Body blank to suppress sending of Pending emails.

param.name: reg_pend_appr_msg
param.translated-default: Greetings [NAME], Thank you for signing up with us. We have received your request and we will process it as soon as you confirm your email address by clicking on the following hyperlink: [CONFIRM] Once your email address is confirmed our moderators will be notified to continue the activation process. You will be notified by email of the progress of your sign up process. [DETAILS] Kind Regards, Website Administration Team
param.label: Pending Email Body
param.description: Input the substitution supported body to send with Pending emails. Leave Pending Subject and Body blank to suppress sending of Pending emails. Additional supported substitutions as follows: [NAME], [USERNAME], [DETAILS] (contains name, username and email address), [PASSWORD], and [CONFIRM] (users email confirmation link).

param.name: reg_welcome_sub
param.label: Welcome Email Subject
param.description: Input the subject to send with Welcome emails. Leave Welcome Subject and Body blank to suppress sending of Welcome emails.

param.name: reg_welcome_msg
param.translated-default: Welcome [NAME], Your application has been approved by our administration team. Your account with the following details: [DETAILS] has been activated. We welcome you to our online community and trust that together we will grow. Enjoy the experience! Kind Regards, Website Administration Team
param.label: Welcome Email Body
param.description: Input the substitution supported body to send with Welcome emails. Leave Welcome Subject and Body blank to suppress sending of Welcome emails. Additional supported substitutions as follows: [NAME], [USERNAME], [DETAILS] (contains name, username, email address, and password), [PASSWORD], and [CONFIRM] (users email confirmation link).

param.name: reg_layout
param.label: Registration Layout
param.description: Choose how to display tabs and fields on registration.

param.name: reg_show_icons_explain
param.label: Registration Icon Legend
param.description: Choose how to display field icons legend on registration.

param.name: reg_title_img
param.label: Registration Title Image
param.description: Choose which image to use for the registration title background image.

param.name: reg_intro_msg
param.translated-default: Welcome to our community - tell us about yourself and sign up
param.label: Registration Header
param.description: Input the the text/html to display at the top of the registration page.

param.name: reg_conclusion_msg
param.translated-default: Thanks for visiting our site! Hope you enjoy your stay!
param.label: Registration Footer
param.description: Input the the text/html to display at the bottom of the registration page.

param.name: reg_first_visit_url
param.label: First Login Redirect
param.description: Input the URL to redirect to on first login. Leave blank to use CB Login module redirect setting.

param.name: usernameedit
param.label: Username Edit
param.description: Choose if users can change their username.

param.name: usernamefallback
param.label: Username Fallback
param.description: Choose which field to use as username if username field is not preset at time of user store. If fallback fails to provide a value then user email address will be used.

param.name: adminrequiredfields
param.label: Fields Validation in User Management
param.description: Choose if users fields should validate while editing them within User Management. This can be very useful if user has multiple required fields that are incomplete, but an admin needs to edit the user.

param.name: profile_viewaccesslevel
param.label: Profile View Access Level
param.description: Select the view access level required for viewing user profiles. Only users with this view access level will be able to access the profile, as well as the profile owner himself.

param.name: maxEmailsPerHr
param.label: Maximum Emails per Hour
param.description: Input the maximum emails per hour a user can send another user.

param.name: profile_recordviews
param.label: Record Views
param.description: Choose if profile views should record. If disabled views will not log to the database and the views field will not increment.

param.name: minHitsInterval
param.label: Minimum Hits Interval in Minutes
param.description: Input the minimum interval between views and hits counting of a displayed user by a viewing user.

param.name: templatedir
param.label: Template
param.description: Choose which template to be used for all of frontend Community Builder display. New templates can be installed as template plugins within Plugin Management.

param.name: use_divs
param.label: Template Output
param.description: Choose if tables or divs should be used for template outputs.

param.name: left2colsWidth
param.label: Left
param.description: Input 2 column profile layout width as percentage. Only left column will adjust as the right column will use whatever space remains.

param.name: left3colsWidth
param.label: Left
param.description: Input 3 column profile layout width as percentage. Only left and right columns will adjust as the middle column will use whatever space remains.

param.name: showEmptyTabs
param.label: Show Empty Tabs
param.description: Choose if tabs with no content should still display.

param.name: showEmptyFields
param.label: Show Empty Fields
param.description: Choose if fields with no content should still display.

param.name: emptyFieldsText
param.label: Empty Field Text
param.description: Input the substitution and language string supported text to display for empty fields.

param.name: frontend_userparams
param.label: Allow CMS User Parameters
param.description: Choose if users can edit their CMS user parameters field.

param.name: profile_edit_layout
param.label: Profile Edit Layout
param.description: Choose how to display tabs and fields on profile edit.

param.name: profile_edit_show_icons_explain
param.label: Profile Edit Icon Legend
param.description: Choose how to display field icons legend on profile edit.

param.name: html_filter_allowed_tags
param.label: Exclude Tags from Filtering
param.description: Input the tags separated by a space to exclude from filtering (e.g. applet body bgsound embed). The defaults can be reversed by supplying: applet body bgsound base basefont embed frame frameset head html id iframe ilayer layer link meta name object script style title xml. Note some tags could allow for malware or abusive behavior.

param.name: conversiontype
param.label: Image Software
param.description: Choose the software to use for processing images.

param.name: avatarResizeAlways
param.label: Always Resample Image Uploads
param.description: Choose if images uploaded should always be resampled. Resampling adds additional security, but animations will only be kept when using ImageMagick.

param.name: avatarHeight
param.label: Default Maximum Image Height
param.description: Input the maximum image height in pixels of uploaded images. This can be changed on an image field by field bases while editing image field types.

param.name: avatarWidth
param.label: Default Maximum Image Width
param.description: Input the maximum image width in pixels of uploaded images. This can be changed on an image field by field bases while editing image field types.

param.name: avatarSize
param.label: Default Maximum Image Filesize
param.description: Input the maximum image filesize in kilobytes of uploaded images. This can be changed on an image field by field bases while editing image field types.

param.name: thumbHeight
param.label: Default Maximum Thumbnail Height
param.description: Input the maximum image thumbnail height in pixels of uploaded images. This can be changed on an image field by field bases while editing image field types.

param.name: thumbWidth
param.label: Default Maximum Thumbnail Width
param.description: Input the maximum image thumbnail width in pixels of uploaded images. This can be changed on an image field by field bases while editing image field types.

param.name: avatarMaintainRatio
param.label: Maintain Aspect Ratio
param.description: Choose if images uploaded should maintain their aspect ratio when resizing. If set to No the image will always be resized to the specified maximum width and height. If set to Yes the aspect ratio will be maintained as much as possible within the maximum width and height. If set to Yes with Cropping the image will always resize to the specified maximum width and height within the aspect ratio and crop any overflow; this is useful for maintain squared images.

param.name: moderator_viewaccesslevel
param.label: Moderators View Access Level
param.description: Select the view access level required for moderator privileges.

param.name: allowModUserApproval
param.label: Moderator Approve Users
param.description: Choose if moderators can approve users registration.

param.name: moderatorEmail
param.label: Send Moderators Email
param.description: Choose if moderators should receive emails if an action is performed requiring moderator attention.

param.name: allowUserReports
param.label: Allow User Reports
param.description: Choose if users can report other users for inappropriate behavior to moderators.

param.name: avatarUploadApproval
param.label: Require Upload Image Approval
param.description: Choose if images uploaded by users require moderator approval.

param.name: allowModeratorsUserEdit
param.label: Allow Moderators to Edit User Profiles
param.description: Choose if moderators can edit users profiles. Moderators can not edit same or higher-level moderators. Note moderators must have Access Administration Interface and Edit permissions within User Management - Permissions.

param.name: allowUserBanning
param.label: Allow Profile Banning
param.description: Choose if moderators can ban users profiles from being displayed.

param.name: allowConnections
param.label: Enable Connections
param.description: Choose if users can establish connections with one another. This is often called a friends or buddy system.

param.name: connectionDisplay
param.label: Display Type
param.description: Choose if connections should remain private to a user or publicly visible.

param.name: connectionPath
param.label: Display Connection Path
param.description: Choose if a connection path between users should be displayed.

param.name: useMutualConnections
param.label: Mutual Consent
param.description: Choose if both parties must agree to a connection request before a connection is established.

param.name: conNotifyType
param.label: Notification Method
param.description: Choose how connection request notifications should be sent.

param.name: autoAddConnections
param.label: Cross Connections
param.description: Choose if connections should be established between both parties or just the user sending the request.

param.name: connection_categories
param.label: Connection Types
param.description: Input connection types separated by a line break that users can assign to connections.

param.name: translations_debug
param.label: Translations Highlighting
param.description: Choose how to display translations highlighting. This can best be used to debug missing translations.

param.name: enableSpoofCheck
param.label: Spoof Checking
param.description: Choose if anti-spoof session checking should be used. Highly recommended this be left on, but it sometimes can conflict with caching usages.

param.name: noVersionCheck
param.label: Version Checking
param.description: Choose if Community Builder version checking should be automated or manually triggered in Configuration. Only Community Builder version and standard HTTP information is disclosed during version checking.

param.name: pluginVersionCheck
param.label: Plugin Version Checking
param.description: Choose if Plugin version checking should be automated in Plugin Management.

param.name: installFromWeb
param.label: Install from Web
param.description: Choose if install from web should be available within plugin install.

param.name: sendemails
param.label: Send Emails
param.description: Choose if Community Builder should send emails or not. Note this only affects Community Builder emails through Community Builder API.

param.name: templateBootstrap
param.label: Twitter Bootstrap
param.description: Choose if Twitter Bootstrap CSS should be loaded from the Community Builder template automatically. Recommended to always leave this on unless another compatible means of Twitter Bootstrap CSS is loaded. Note this will affect frontend only.

param.default: Note Community Builder Twitter Bootstrap CSS has been shut off for frontend. Please ensure another means of Twitter Bootstrap is available. This could cause styling conflicts or missing styling.

param.name: templateFontawesme
param.label: Fontawesome
param.description: Choose if Fontawesome CSS should be loaded from the Community Builder template automatically. Recommended to always leave this on unless another compatible means of Fontawesome CSS is loaded. Note this will affect frontend only.

param.default: Note Community Builder Fontawesome CSS has been shut off for frontend. Please ensure another means of Fontawesome is available. This could cause styling conflicts or missing styling.

param.name: jsJquery
param.label: jQuery
param.description: Choose if jQuery should be loaded from the Community Builder JS automatically. Recommended to always leave this on unless another compatible means of jQuery is loaded. Note this will affect frontend only.

param.default: Note Community Builder jQuery has been shut off for frontend. Please ensure another means of jQuery is available. This could cause compatibility issues with jQuery plugins.

param.name: jsJqueryMigrate
param.label: jQuery Migrate
param.description: Choose if jQuery Migrate should be loaded from the Community Builder JS automatically. Recommended to always leave this on unless another compatible means of jQuery Migrate is loaded or all jQuery usages are compatible with the loaded version of jQuery. Note this will affect frontend only.

param.default: Note Community Builder jQuery Migrate has been shut off for frontend. Please ensure another means of jQuery Migrate is available or all jQuery usage is compatible with the loaded version of jQuery. This could cause compatibility issues with jQuery usages.
